text: ( A ) Nuclear extracts of A3.01 T cells were incubated with a 32P-labeled commercial <extra_id_0> Sp1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> oligonucleotide probe ( Sp1cons ) or labeled probes homologous to the unmodified or mutated E2 region ( see Figure 1 ) of the <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter ( APO - <extra_id_0> Sp1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and APO - <extra_id_0> Sp1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mut ) .
Protein - DNA complexes were separated by polyacrylamide electrophoresis and detected by autoradiography .

EMSA was performed with a 1 - or 30-fold molar excess of unlabeled APO - <extra_id_0> Sp1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> probe ( competitor , lanes 6 and 7 ) or APO - <extra_id_0> Sp1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mut probe ( competitor mut . , lanes 12 and 13 ) .

( B ) <extra_id_0> Sp1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - and <extra_id_0> Sp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - specific antibodies were added to the EMSA reactions resulting in a supershift ( ss ) of the respective antibody-protein-oligo complexes ( lanes 3 , 4 , 7 , 8 , 11 , 12 ) .
( C ) ChIP assay was performed with DNA from A3.01 T cells .

Immunoprecipitation was performed with antibodies against <extra_id_0> Sp1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> Sp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or <extra_id_0> actin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

PCR primer pairs specific for the <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter ( upper panel ) or the <extra_id_0> A3G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene ( lower panel ) were used .
As positive controls , the sheared and cross-linked DNA before the immunoprecipitation step ( input ) or a plasmid carrying the target sequence ( plasmid ) was used as template .
